Column Comment.0: NOTIFICATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the notification.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.3: CONTRACT INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that the notification is for acontract.
Column Comment.4: CRITICAL DATE: the date that the notification must be replied to.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, acquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.8: LAND RIGHT INDICATOR: A yes / no flag indicating that the notification is for a landright.
Column Comment.9: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: This column is used to enforce the relationship betweenLAND RIGHT and its subtypes. The value must be equal to the name of one of thevalid subtypes: LAND_AGREEMENT, LAND_AGREE_PART, LAND_LEASE,LAND_GRANTED_RIGHT, LAND_UNIT, LAND_UNIT_TRACT or LAND_TITLE.
Column Comment.10: NOTIFICATION TYPE: the type of notification.
Column Comment.11: OBLIGATION: a condition of commitment on the agreement which must be fulfilled.There are many types of obligations and the fulfillment of an obligation may require achange to the agreement. e.g. offset obligation, work commitment, section 96 etc.Obligations may be financial (rental payments) or non financial (drilling, reportingetc.)
Column Comment.12: OBLIGATION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this notification hasresulted in an obligation. If desired, populate the OBLIGATION FK to indicate whichobligation has resulted.
Column Comment.13: OBLIGATION SEQ NO: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence of an obligation
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: SERVED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that the notification has been servedto all necessary parties.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
